newsitem.title: INDIA: Bombay sugar prices firm ahead of two-day strike.
newsitem.headline: Bombay sugar prices firm ahead of two-day strike.

text.p: Bombay sugar prices firmed on Tuesday helped by restricted arrivals, high consumer demand and and ahead of a two-day strike by traders protesting a tax hike, dealers said.
"An announcement by traders that sugar markets would be closed on Wednesday and Thursday to protest a tax hike by the government also triggered higher offtake," one dealer said.

Ready delivery sugar S-30 rose by 15 rupees to 1,280/1,340 rupees per quintal while M-30 gained by 13/35 rupees to 1,333/1,410 rupees. Sugar mill delivery however slid from 1,210/1,220 rupees to 1,190/1,210 rupees per quintal on sluggish outstation buying.
